citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There was no written program of veterinary care available for review. The facility representative stated the last program of
veterinary care was in place when the facility had sugar gliders and was disposed of when the sugar gliders were sold.
The facility representative stated the 4 rabbits present at the facility had not been examined by a veterinarian. The rabbits
appeared healthy and in good body condition.
Failure to have written formal arrangements with an attending veterinarian that includes regularly scheduled visits to the
premises can result in inadequate veterinary care and negatively affect the welfare of the animals.
Each dealer must employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements which include a written program of
veterinary care and regularly scheduled visits to the facility.
Correct by: March 13, 2024

There were no inventory records for the 4 rabbits present at the facility. In addition, there were no acquisition records for
the rabbits.
Failure to maintain these records can make it difficult to track animals being used in regulated activities to ensure their
humane care and use.
The facility must maintain records containing the required information for animals which fully and correctly disclose the
number of animals held, owned, and acquired or disposed of including births and deaths.
Correct by: February 28, 2024

There was no written contingency plan on file at the facility.
Failure to have a written contingency plan can result in lack of readiness for emergencies or disasters.
Facilities must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment,
transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster.
Correct by: March 13, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
